sub_title: Senior Researcher / Teacher at Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen
summary:
I am an engineer educated in the field of sustainability, energy production technology and energy transportation, with practical background learned by; attending Preparatory Vocational Secondary Education (LTS) and Senior Secondary Vocational Education (MTS); theoretical background learned by following a Bachelor of Engineering (B Eng.); a background in Energy and Environmental sciences learned by attending a Master of Science (MSc.); and a research background learned by finishing a PhD in the field of energy and environmental sciences at the University of Groningen and the Hanze University of Applied Sciences 

Specialties: Specialized in sustainable engineering, with focus on Material and Energy Flow Analysis and Life Cycle Analysis.

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

projects.title: Flexiheat project
projects.description: Within this project I have been given an advisory role in the Attero case. Within this case Attero is researching the optimization of their steam system, powered by waste combustion, on electricity and heat output regarding economics.

contributors.headline: Senior Researcher / Teacher at Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

projects.title: Storage label Project
projects.description: The energy storage label project was initiated by Netbeheer Nederland to come up with a transparent comparison method between storage solutions. This resulted in the Energy storage label.

contributors.headline: Senior Researcher / Teacher at Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

projects.title: Macredes
projects.description:
Within the Macredes project I was asked to build a model which can help local communities Design their own local renewable energy system. The model and the game designed around the model is to help communities design their own local renewable energy systems and to educate
1) Design the renewable energy system using an fun interactive stakeholder game
2) Designing the renewable energy system involves
3) Understanding your existing energy system
4) Defining  social, environmental, and business goals and  security of supply 
5) Design of technical architecture and commercial business opportunities
6) Evaluate your design against social, environment, and business goals
This resulted in the Clean Energy Design Tool which is being used for educational purposes and local energy initiatives as we speak.

projects.title: Flexigas
projects.description: The Flexigas project is working towards economic and sustainable integration of biogas into the future national and decentralised energy system, also called the smart grid. I will be looking to the sustainability of biogas production within a decentralised smart energy grid.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the (Renewable) Energy Advisary Group of the Municipality of Ten Boer
volunteer_experiences.description: Local energy saving and renewable production is becoming more and more popular, also due to intensives from the government. The Energy Advisary Group of the Municipality of Ten Boer was created to inform the population and to advice the regulatory board of the Municipality of Ten Boer.

Within the community of Ten Boer near the city of Groningen within the Netherlands an energy cooperation has started with the goal of reducing energy demand and integrating renewable energy withing the community; With the people, By the people, and for the people in Ten Boer.
